Sentencas: Nano-sized CSO (Ce0.80Sm0.20O2-delta) and CSCO (Ce0.79Sm0.20Cu0.01O2-delta) were synthesized by the PVA-assisted combustion method, and then characterized by the structure of PVA-cation complexes and nano-powders, as well as mechanical and electrical performance after sintering.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of Cu-Sm co-doped CeO2 electrolytes

Sentencas: Low temperatures (around 200 degrees C) caused intense combustion reactions, resulting in the direct crystallization of cubic fluorite nano-CSO (10-20 nm) and nano-CSCO (10-15 nm) crystals with homogeneous element distribution.
Titulo: Combustion synthesis and characterization of Cu-Sm co-doped CeO2 electrolytes

Sentencas: This slight compositional modification of CSO by co-doping with 1 mol% CuO resulted in a significantly lowered densification temperature, as well as enhanced mechanical and electrical property.

Sentencas: The strength improvement can be ascribed to the dense and fine-grained microstructure without normal grain coarsening, resulting in a transgranular-dominant fracture mode during strength testing.
